boat.full_description:
'Growler' was built at Conyer Creek in 1922, reputedly a 1/3 sized version of the Thames barge 'Sara'. She spent the majority of her life cruising on the River Swale and around the Thames estuary. By the early 1990s she had fallen into a state of neglect and was rescued by Gus Curtis of Harry Kings Boatyard, Pin Mill. He then passed her on to Ash Faire-Ring who plans to restore her back to full working order.

Follow progress on YouTube
boat.name: Growler

ownerships.note: Owned by Gus Curtis prior to 2019 for an unknown length of time, he did not sail her, but stored in her in a barn at Dedham.

boat.short_description: Built by White Bros., 1922, 'Growler' is a1/3 size version of the Thames barge 'Sara'. She spent her working life on the East Coast of England.
